summary: The Department of Homeland Security is planning to consolidate operations and thousands of its workers at the St. Elizabeths campus in Washington, D.C. Construction began at the site in 2009. Over $2 billion has been appropriated for the project since fiscal year 2006, which was less than requested. DHS and General Services Administration officials told us this led to cost increases and delays. Since our...
title: Federal Real Property: DHS and GSA Have Not Implemented Recommendations to Strengthen the Management of DHS Headquarters Consolidation
